name: SFCertificateView
desc: A view that displays the contents of a certificate, with options to display certificate details, display trust settings, and allow users to edit a certificate’s trust settings.

items.name: func certificate() -> Unmanaged<SecCertificate>!
items.desc: Returns the certificate currently displayed in the view.

items.name: func detailsDisclosed() -> Bool
items.desc: Returns whether the view currently shows the certificate’s details.

items.name: func detailsDisplayed() -> Bool
items.desc: Indicates if the view currently shows the certificate’s details.

items.name: func isEditable() -> Bool
items.desc: Indicates if the view allows the user to edit the certificate’s trust.

items.name: func isTrustDisplayed() -> Bool
items.desc: Indicates if the view currently shows the certificate’s trust settings.

items.name: func policies() -> [Any]!
items.desc: Returns an array of policies used to evaluate the status of the displayed certificate.

items.name: func policiesDisclosed() -> Bool
items.desc: Returns whether the trust policy subview is disclosed.

items.name: func saveTrustSettings()
items.desc: Saves the user’s current trust settings for the displayed certificate.

items.name: func setCertificate(SecCertificate!)
items.desc: Specifies the certificate that’s displayed in the view.

items.name: func setDetailsDisclosed(Bool)
items.desc: Sets whether the certificate details subview is disclosed.

items.name: func setDisplayDetails(Bool)
items.desc: Specifies whether the user can see the certificate details.

items.name: func setDisplayTrust(Bool)
items.desc: Specifies whether the user can see the certificate’s trust settings.

items.name: func setEditableTrust(Bool)
items.desc: Specifies whether the user can edit the certificate’s trust settings.

items.name: func setPolicies(Any!)
items.desc: Specifies the policies to use when evaluating this certificate’s status.

items.name: func setPoliciesDisclosed(Bool)
items.desc: Specifies whether the trust policy settings subview is disclosed.
